(o) "Interim Certificate" means the certificate referred to in Clause 26.2 (Issue of Interim Certificates).

(dd) "Taking-Over Certificate" has the meaning assigned by Clause 20.1 (Taking-Over Certificate).
(ee) "Tender" means the Contractor's priced offer to the Employer for the carrying out and completion of the Works and the remedying of defects therein.
(ff) "Tests on Completion" means such tests to be made by the Contractor before the relevant Section or Portion of the Works is taken over by the Employer as are provided for in the Contract or otherwise agreed between the Employer or the Supervision Consultant and the Contractor.
(gg) "Variation Order" has the meaning assigned by Clause 22.1 (Variation Orders).
(hh) "Works" means all Plant to be provided and work to be done by the Contractor under the Contract.

6A. FREE ISSUE ITEMS
Definition
6A.1 The expression "Free Issue Items" shall mean those items (if any) to be provided by the Employer for incorporation in the Works by the Contractor under the Contract.
Collection and Taking Delivery
6A.2 (a) The Employer shall make the Free Issue Items available for collection by the Contractor or shall deliver (or shall arrange for others to deliver) the Free Issue Items to the Contractor as described in the Specification.
(b) The Contractor shall collect or take delivery of (as applicable) the Free Issue Items from the Employer at the points of collection or delivery described in the Specification.
(c) The Contractor shall inspect Free Issue Items at the said points prior to collection or immediately upon taking delivery as applicable and shall promptly notify the Project Manager with a copy to the Employer of any shortage, defect or damage. Such notification shall be accompanied by full details of the said shortage, defect or damage. After the receipt of any such notification, the Project Manager may arrange for the Employer himself to take all necessary steps to rectify the said shortage, defect or damage or may instruct the Contractor in writing to carry out such rectification as a variation under Clause 22 (Variations). All additional Costs to the Employer as determined by the Project Manager arising from any failure by the Contractor to so notify the Project Manager at the time of collection or taking delivery (as applicable) as aforesaid of any such shortage, defect or damage shall be recoverable from the Contractor by the Employer as a debt due from the Contractor, or may be deducted by the Employer from any monies due or which may become due to the Contractor. Any delays in the carrying out and completion of the Works arising from such failure by the Contractor shall be the responsibility of the Contractor.
(d) The Contractor shall acknowledge in writing to the Project Manager the collection or taking delivery of (as applicable) the Free Issue Items by the Contractor.
Risk and Care
6A.3 The risk in the Free Issue Items shall pass from the Employer to the Contractor immediately upon the collection or taking delivery thereof (as applicable) in accordance with Clause 6A.2 (Collection and Taking Delivery) and accordingly the Contractor shall thereafter take full responsibility for the care thereof.
Installation
6A.4 The Contractor shall upon collecting or taking delivery of (as applicable) the Free Issue Items in accordance with Clause 6A.2 (Collection and Taking Delivery) transport, unload, unpack as necessary (and return or dispose of the packings as instructed by the Project Manager in writing), handle, store, protect and (as applicable and as described in the Specification) fabricate, assemble, install, erect, test and commission the said Items.
Notification of Damage
6A.5 The Contractor shall be responsible at all times for identifying at the earliest opportunity any loss of, defects in or damage to the Free Issue Items following the collection or taking delivery thereof (as applicable) in accordance with Clause 6A.2 (Collection and Taking Delivery). The Contractor shall promptly notify the Project Manager with a copy to the Employer upon the identification of any such loss, defect or damage. After the receipt of any such notification, the Project Manager may arrange for the Employer himself to take all necessary steps to rectify the said loss, defect or damage or may instruct the Contractor in writing to carry out such rectification as a variation under Clause 22 (Variations). All additional Costs to the Employer as determined by the Project Manager arising from any failure by the Contractor to so identify and notify the Project Manager of any such loss, defect or damage shall be recoverable from the Contractor by the Employer as a debt due from the Contractor, or may be deducted by the Employer from any monies due or which may become due to the Contractor. Any delays in the carrying out and completion of the Works arising from such failure by the Contractor shall be the responsibility of the Contractor.
Surplus Items
6A.6 (a) The Contractor shall not use the Free Issue Items for any purpose other than the carrying out and completion of the Works.
(b) Any surplus Free Issue Items shall be returned in good condition by the Contractor to the Employer to a storage area to be notified to the Contractor by the Project Manager.
Removal from Site
6A.7 The Contractor shall not remove any of the Free Issue Items from the Site.

Time For Tests

The Contractor shall give to the Project Manager, (with a copy to the Supervision Consultant), not less than fourteen (14) days' prior written notice of the date after which the Contractor will be ready to commence the Tests on Completion for any Section or Portion of the Works. Unless otherwise agreed between the Project Manager, Supervision Consultant and the Contractor, the Tests on Completion shall commence within ten (10) days after the said date on such day and at such time as the Supervision Consultant shall notify the Contractor in writing and the Tests on Completion shall thereafter be carried out continuously until completed. If the Supervision Consultant fails so to notify the Contractor or to attend at the time so notified the Contractor may nevertheless commence and carry out the Tests on Completion which shall be deemed to have been made in the Supervision Consultant's presence. 22A. PROVISIONAL SUMS
Definition of Provisional Sum
22A.1 "Provisional Sum" means a sum (if any) included in the Contract Sum and so designated in the Bills of Quantities for work to be done and/or Plant to be provided, such sum being an estimate of the value of such work and/or Plant.
Valuation of Provisional Sums
22A.2 The value of work done and/or Plant provided to which Provisional Sums relate shall be determined in accordance with the Bills of Quantities and the Particular Conditions and the Contractor shall be paid such value in accordance with Clause 26 (Interim and Final Certificates).
Nomination
22A.3 In respect of each part of the Works (if any) covered by a Provisional Sum in the Bills of Quantities or defined in the Contract as an optional scope the Employer shall nominate the person to receive a subcontract from the Contractor for such part of the Works and shall notify the Contractor of such nomination.
Competitive Tendering
22A.4 In respect of each part of the Works (if any) covered by a Provisional Sum in the Bills of Quantities which is described therein as to be subject to competitive tendering as described in this Clause 22A.4, the following provisions shall apply to each such part of the Works.
(a) The Contractor shall obtain competitive tenders from tenderers approved by the Employer. The Contractor shall in respect of each such part submit for the approval of the Employer a list of its proposed tenderers. The Contractor shall include in its lists of tenderers any firms proposed by the Employer.
(b) The tender documents shall be prepared by the Contractor and shall be submitted to the Employer for review and comment (with the tender documents being amended by the Contractor to take into account any such comments) prior to issue by the Contractor to tenderers. Such tender documents shall advise tenderers that whilst tenders are to be addressed to the Contractor, they are to be delivered directly to the Employer in plain envelopes or parcels with wax seals marked for the attention of the Chairman of the Tender Committee and are not to be copied to the Contractor. Such tender documents shall include without limitation the provisions stated in the Particular Conditions as to be included in such documents. The Contractor shall provide the Employer with copies of any addenda, tender bulletins, tender circulars and the like in relation to such tender documents at the same time as they are issued by the Contractor to tenderers.
(c) The tenders shall be opened in private by the Tender Committee of the Employer and a copy passed to the Contractor for evaluation. The Contractor shall submit its evaluation of both the technical and commercial aspects of the tenders to the Employer marked for the attention of the Chairman of the Tender Committee together with its recommendations as to the tenderer to be awarded the subcontract.
Thereafter, the Contractor and, if required by the Employer, one or more of the tenderers, shall attend meetings with the Employer, the Project Manager and the Supervision Consultant to discuss the tenders and the Contractor shall provide any further details, documents and explanations as required by the Employer, the Project Manager or the Supervision Consultant.
(d) Following the conclusion of the tender evaluation process, the Contractor shall obtain the written approval of the Employer to enter into a subcontract with the selected tenderer and following the receipt of such approval the Contractor shall enter into a subcontract with the approved tenderer. Provided that the Contractor shall submit the proposed subcontract documents to the Employer for review and comment and shall amend such document to take into account any such comments prior to entering into the said subcontract.
The comments and approvals given by the Employer and the involvement of the Employer, the Project Manager and the Supervision Consultant in the tendering process pursuant to this Clause 22A.4 shall not release the Contractor from any of its obligations or liabilities under the Contract.

text:
In the Contract, "Force Majeure" means an exceptional event or circumstance:
(a) which is beyond a party's control; and
(b) which such party could not reasonably have provided against before entering into the Contract; and
(c) which, having arisen, such party could not reasonably have avoided or overcome; and
(d) which is not substantially attributable to the other party.
Force Majeure may include but is not limited to, exceptional events or circumstances of the kind listed below, provided that conditions (a) to (d) above are satisfied:
(i) (insofar as they directly interfere with the progress of the Works and relate to and directly affect the Country) war, or (unless it is solely restricted to employees of the Contractor or of its Subcontractors and arising from the conduct of the Works) riot, commotion or disorder in the Country; or
(ii) ionising radiation or contamination by radio-activity from any nuclear fuel or from any nuclear waste from the combustion of nuclear fuel, radio-active toxic explosives or other hazardous properties of any explosive nuclear assembly or nuclear components thereof.

The Employer shall (without prejudice to his right to recover from the Contractor damages arising out of the Contractor's default together with damages for all consequential loss) then be liable to pay to the Contractor only an amount certified by the Project Manager and calculated as being:
(a) the amount shown by the final account prepared in accordance with Clause 30.5 (Valuation at Entry and Expulsion); less
(b) the total of all payments already made to the Contractor pursuant to Interim Certificates or otherwise and to any Nominated Subcontractor under Clause 24.2 (Delayed Payments to Nominated Subcontractors); less
(c) any amount by which the Costs of completing the Works and other Costs incurred by the Employer in relation thereto exceed the difference between the amount which would have been payable to the Contractor upon due completion of the Works by it and the amounts shown by the final account; and less
(d) any amount which is or becomes payable under Clause 19.3 (Liquidated Damages).
If the foregoing calculation should produce a negative result then the Contractor shall upon demand pay a sum equal to that result to the Employer and such sum shall be deemed a debt due from the Contractor to the Employer and be recoverable accordingly.

text:
If the Contract is terminated under Clause 31.1 (Termination for Convenience) or Clause 31.2 (Default of Employer) such termination shall be without prejudice to any rights or obligations which may have accrued due between the parties prior to such termination. Following such termination, the Contractor shall promptly cease all further work, except for such work as may be instructed by the Employer for the protection of life or property or for the safety of the Works, submit to the Project Manager all Contractor's Drawings, comply with any instructions of the Employer in relation to Plant not yet delivered to Site, remove from the Site, with the prior consent of the Project Manager, all Contractor's Equipment and submit to the Project Manager in triplicate an Interim Certificate application prepared and accompanied in accordance with Clause 26.1 (Application for Interim Certificates) up to the time of termination. The Project Manager shall consider the Interim Certificate application, prepare an Interim Certificate up to such time and issue the same in accordance with Clause 26.2 (Issue of Interim Certificates) and payment thereof shall be made in accordance with Clause 27 (Payment).
Thereafter, as soon as the required documents and evidence have become available the Contractor shall prepare and submit to the Project Manager in triplicate a final account (together with all such documents and evidence as the Project Manager may require in order to substantiate the same) which shows and breaks down in such form and with such detail as the Project Manager may require all amounts which in the Contractor's opinion represent the items listed in paragraphs (a) to (d) inclusive of Clause 29.8 (Payment on Frustration or Force Majeure) together with the amount which in the Contractor's opinion represents any other reasonably foreseeable loss or damage to the Contractor arising out of or in connection with such termination but excluding any loss of use or profit or indirect or consequential loss.
Such final account shall be adjusted as appropriate to reflect the amounts in respect of the foregoing items which in the Project Manager's opinion are fair and reasonable and the adjusted final account shall be agreed to and signed by the Project Manager and the Contractor. Thereupon the Contractor shall submit to the Project Manager in triplicate a Final Certificate application (prepared and accompanied in accordance with Clause 26.3 (Application for Final Certificates)) from which the Project Manager shall prepare and issue a Final Certificate in accordance with Clause 26.4 (Issue of Final Certificates) and payment thereof shall be made in accordance with Clause 27 (Payment). Notwithstanding the said Clause 26.4, where this Clause operates the Final Certificate shall not be evidence of the matters stated in paragraph (a) of Clause 26.3 (Application for Final Certificates).
